da0b6905-eab6-4910-b5a2-9eb93be4243d: A layer of acidic slime coats a babau's skin. Any creature that strikes a babau with a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from this slime if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g}. The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
1cfcf4c6-3c8a-4993-aadc-651f280d2b64: A mysterious benefactor has come to the Commander's rescue. Hidden by a spell of invisibility, the Commander can now leave the cage and look for a way to escape. However, {mf|he|she} should be cautious. The prison guards are trained to hunt down fugitives, and it would be unwise to underestimate them.
b9917b8b-30e9-4e42-b422-5e3689a29c1d:
A shambling mound's vines coil around any creature it hits with a slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The shambling mound attempts a grapple {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} against its target, and on a successful check its vines deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}+5 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and the foe is grappled.
Grappled characters cannot move, and take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all attack rolls and a -4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Grappled characters attempt to escape every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a successful combat maneuver, {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this check is the shambling mound's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}.
Each round, creatures grappled by a shambling mound suffer 4d6+10 damage.
A shambling mound receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on grapple maneuver checks.
d8ba7b56-d64a-4fe9-a355-0d46eab62296: After {name} ascended the throne of Alushinyrra, many demons followed {mf|him|her} to Drezen. The Commander should speak to them and see that they put their skills to use.
0d85a9a9-e2e6-4357-9c68-f1048670941b: All demon's {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} of demons and count as having +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. Additionally, all demon's natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} count as primary.
e8cf5a44-c36a-4c9e-b91f-bcdd4fde1067: All enemies in a 30-foot radius make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g}. If it fails, they become enraged, gaining {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} as from your Demonic Rage, but they also {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} the nearest target. The duration is 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, but affected enemies can make a saving throw each round to end the effect.
19f5152d-f8ac-4efc-b95e-b633ea1bc51d: Alushinyrra is abuzz — something inconceivable has happened! A bloody fight for power has unfolded in the Lady in Shadow's palace, and now Alushinyrra has a new ruler — a mortal whose heart harbors the power of the Abyss itself.
2649b01f-8914-4443-8761-bd8ced3b9fb9: Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targeting you during demonic rage has a 50% chance to miss.
835aa0ac-2626-4765-a09c-53fee617e92d: Ar-Mikheth has fallen, and the shadow demons have a new leader. The title was inherited in full accordance with the traditions of the Abyss — lightning-fast, while the predecessor's blood still steamed on the blade.
57694325-4ecc-4a6c-8b91-10016b234c94: Ar-Mikheth is dead, and now the Commander must ensure that Yozz keeps his end of the bargain. After all, as head of the Assassins' Guild, he knows very well that sometimes it is cheaper to have the assassin killed than to pay him the reward due.
6a4ce3bb-561d-4957-93e3-54cc24f258c4: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} once per day per growth point (minimum of 1/day), a nabasu can activate its {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}-stealing gaze for a full {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. All living creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 18 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or gain a negative level. The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}-based.
dba94317-a194-46d8-a5d0-73bf9ce5600a: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, you can teleport to the target enemy, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} unholy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per mythic rank to all enemies in a 10-foot range around the beginning point of the teleport and at the end point. An enemy can only be damaged by this ability once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
1f5e09df-df6f-4cf6-ae1f-32bc3f6c0631: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, you teleport to any point up to long distance.
5f2c0e49-ccc3-4122-b1e3-9ea2dd80b3b5: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} once per minute, a gallu can command the wounds of all creatures within 30 feet to erupt into a gory deluge of blood; any wounded creature in the area of effect immediately takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the rain of blood and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 31 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}. Failure indicates that the damage becomes bleed damage and the affected creature becomes staggered from the pain as long as the bleed damage continues. Creatures that are immune to bleed damage are immune to this ability's effects. The save DCs are {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
a7856cb6-080f-4797-87be-825db5753b56: Aspect of Deskari makes all your {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} dealt while in demonic rage become Unholy, and your {g|Encyclopedia:Physical_Damage}physical damage{/g} ignores physical {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} immunity or {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
58e5dfb5-4118-4a50-8a97-ba383aedfc9c: Aspect of Kabriri allows you to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} every time you kill an enemy during demonic rage.
cdc1ce8a-7f95-4d84-83d3-0c8336721148: Aspect of Pazuzu makes your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} 30 feet greater during demonic rage, and gives you one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (this effect stacks with haste).
e27a6979-9110-42d7-9be6-b2d8e4107873: At 5th rank and at 7th rank, Demon gains a Major Demonic Aspect. These aspects use more powerful demons as inspiration and allow the Demon to focus the rage more effectively.
dfd27b62-8be3-4398-883a-446da4c9c2cb: At the 9th mythic rank, Demon gains a Lord Demonic Aspect and another one on 10th mythic rank. These aspects use demon lords as inspiration and allow the Demon to focus the rage more effectively.
7063668e-df2e-4cc1-863a-29e7dc1896d2: By gaining the patronage of the Lady in Shadow and winning the respect of the demons, the Commander has placed {mf|himself|herself} firmly on Alushinyrra's chessboard, where the most influential players fight for power and dominance. Now, whether {mf|he|she} wants it or not, the Commander has become one of the main figures in the tangled web of intrigues that has been woven by the Abyss's most powerful denizens over centuries. Participation in bloody games like these can lead to great rewards, but losers pay with their lives.
b8a94d6e-20f4-40e2-aa7c-3d7dca194259: Change alignment so that nothing good or lawful remains, then speak with Yozz
d94ee2b9-caad-4c3d-a456-9a66d486820a: Chivarro, the madam of a brothel called the Ten Thousand Delights, might have the information the Commander needs. However, as the mistress of a place that sells both pleasure and secrets, it is unlikely she will give up such information for free.
8492b557-a412-4990-9069-fa29cfd22dc1:
Demon adopts the aspect of Babau, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
An aspect of Babau increases the user's sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} during demonic rage by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}. Any creature that strikes the Demon with a Babau aspect during demonic rage with a non-{g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} melee weapon suffers 2d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. Both these damages increase by 1d6 at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
9b0115c4-f67d-426c-80a6-8fef0c52929a:
Demon adopts the aspect of Balor, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
An aspect of Balor makes all allies in a 50-foot radius assume Demonic rage with the Demon himself, but without the advantages of the demonic aspects.
bfd1b03e-e534-49ef-a155-fc57b7a49a77:
Demon adopts the aspect of Brimorak, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
Any creature that strikes the Demon with a Brimorak aspect during demonic rage with a non-{g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} melee weapon suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases by 1d6 at 6th and 9th Demon's rank. Whenever the Demon with an aspect of Brimorak casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals damage in demonic rage, that spell deals +2 point of damage per dice rolled. The bonus to damage increases by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
dc2a1f1a-350a-49ad-a5b8-655e96b07d48:
Demon adopts the aspect of Coloxus, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
The aspect of Coloxus allows the Demon to use abilities and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} as {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move actions{/g} during demonic rage.
fe892490-80f2-4a61-9b54-6200adb47dd9:
Demon adopts the aspect of Incubus, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
Whenever the Demon with an aspect of Incubus casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or uses an ability during a demonic rage, increase it's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. This bonus increases by one at 6th and 9th Demon's rank. While in demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Incubus gains a +4 bonus to weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. The bonus to damage increases by two at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
de4eb355-018f-4484-87dd-8ece55d89bab:
Demon adopts the aspect of Kalavakus, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
While in demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Kalavakus gains a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g}, and natural armor to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The bonus increases by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
Whenever the Demon with an aspect of Kalavakus succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} during a demonic rage, the Demon can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against that target as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. When the Demon with an aspect of Kalavakus hits with a charge attack during a demonic rage, the Demon can attempt to disarm the target as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}.
cbd28e95-5d8f-4705-91f0-eedd6804504a:
Demon adopts the aspect of Nabasu, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Use_Magic_Device}Use Magic Device{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
While in demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Nabasu gains a +2 bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. The bonus increases by one at 6th and 9th Demon's rank.
During a demonic rage, all enemies within 30 feet of a Demon with an aspect of Nabasu gain a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to Fortitude saves and a -1 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. These penalties increase by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
8be7cf7a-61ca-4cb8-89cd-56805984e68f:
Demon adopts the aspect of Omox, gaining {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/- where N is equal to half the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
An aspect of Omox causes all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and abilities make their target grappled unless they pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g}. Base DC to this saving throw is equal 10 + half your character level + your mythic rank + your highest ability modifier.
b75aa437-7245-4dd5-a49d-96c1f8c675ec:
Demon adopts the aspect of Schir, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
While in demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Schir gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}. The bonus increases by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
During a demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Schir gains a Powerful Charge ability, increasing the number of weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice by two and applying an additional one and half of the Demon's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} bonus to damage from charge.
2f3445ee-82a2-4c0a-bc3d-5f95b368d765:
Demon adopts the aspect of Shadow Demon, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} score equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
An aspect of Shadow Demon makes the user {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g} during demonic rage.
096383ee-0dc0-49cf-a26b-fe9552d5e35d:
Demon adopts the aspect of Succubus, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
During a demonic rage, all enemies within 30 feet of a Demon with an aspect of Succubus gain a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} and a -1 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, while all allies within 30 feet gain a +1 bonus to Will saves and attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, and an immunity to compulsion and fear effects. These penalties and bonuses increase by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
844a57ad-9e33-46f5-adb0-647def76dea5:
Demon adopts the aspect of Vavakia, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
As long as the demon remains in rage, every round the aspect of Vavakia deals all enemies within 50 feet (1 + 1/3 mythic rank, rounded up) {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}d6{/g} unholy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
c2617a86-5a92-425b-9edc-1cc2fd21d38d:
Demon adopts the aspect of Vrock, gaining a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one. Those bonuses do not stack with other bonuses from demonic aspects.
While in demonic rage, the Demon with an aspect of Vrock gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}. The bonus increases by one at 6th and 9th Demon's rank. All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and non-physical abilities that the Demon with an aspect of Vrock uses during a demonic rage count as Reach spells.
During a demonic rage, all enemies within 30 feet of a Demon with an aspect of Vrock gain a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} and move as if on difficult terrain. These penalty increases by one at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
7cbeefb6-1638-451f-903c-7d5cd2ceb7f1:
Demon adopts the aspect of Vrolikai, gaining Fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Healing{/g} equal to half of the Demon's mythic rank plus one.
While in demonic rage, the aspect of Vrolikai makes all demon's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} apply one negative level on enemies who fail a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your mythic rank + max ability modifier).
033030ae-cb14-471c-9144-0090d34cba38: Demonic Overlord can grant himself a +2 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}. Simultaneously only one such effect can be in place.
db473bff-98c4-4120-859a-547f6cdf1b1f: Demonic Regent can grant self a +2 profane {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. Simultaneously only one such effect can be in place.
630aaece-1993-4a5a-b728-f450d6df4127: During demonic rage, any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or ability cast by the Demon makes the affected enemies {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} twice and take the worse result.
9b32a039-6dac-4765-8492-a732022eea2d: Every enemy in a 40-foot radius receives a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
952d2abe-3024-4d60-88cd-0fd96b2d0417: Examine the drawings of Areelu Vorlesh
b2a84ed7-1acb-4c7a-8854-c5690b631ef5: Find and explore the place depicted in Areelu's drawings
809979a7-1074-4ce6-8138-5b526af9ab95: Find the gear that was confiscated by the demons
9d22532e-17fd-4bf9-9145-111e29443cc7: Find the lair of the shadow demons
739ecd27-d9d7-4017-ba2b-5a0670a9797e: For the first time in many centuries, a prisoner of the Ivory Labyrinth has managed to escape. Hepzamirah must face the disgrace of letting a captive escape her grasp. But it was foolish of Baphomet to rely on the security of this prison. After all, when he was held prisoner within its walls, he also found a way to freedom.
fa069122-50fa-4dbb-a9d8-860679a6fe4f: Get information from the madam of the pleasure palace
8660af40-a5df-41b8-8562-c74bcc6122c2: Get information from the master of the gladiator arena
08648c4e-a21e-468a-a9f6-1c968d942200: Gladiator fights are a popular form of entertainment in Alushinyrra. These battles to the death are attended by both ordinary demons, and the "nobility" of the Abyss. Areelu has been known to watch the fights from a special box in the Battlebliss arena. It is possible that the arena master, Irmangaleth, may have information about her that could prove useful.
f7861733-1f07-433b-b063-a5be5a24237f: In the Belly of the Beast
3b1ac055-0bb4-4694-b6d5-66c1a7b74c4a: Kill Ar-Mikheth, leader of the shadow demons
5e691e85-7652-4d98-8ee1-79b5a83968dc: Nocticula has assigned a very influential and well-informed demon to protect the Commander. The demon's personal army of assassins gives him access to even the most well-guarded secrets. A conversation with him may be the first step toward finding Areelu Vorlesh.
6507ad95-078f-4462-821c-89e2de896a43: Nocticula has shown the Commander her favor, but she believes there is too much kindness and mercy in {mf|his|her} heart. Such qualities will inhibit the Commander's demonic ascension, and thus must be ruthlessly eradicated.
47d0d02b-306f-475a-9a40-470171db18d2:
Once every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, a vavakia can breathe out a 60-foot cone of green fire that seems to writhe and coil with the tortured shapes of a thousand screaming ghosts. This green fire comprises countless souls the vavakia has consumed, and these vomited souls consume flesh as surely as they consume sanity. A creature struck by this breath weapon takes 20d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 30 half) as the raw profane power blackens and melts its flesh and skin. Evil creatures take half damage from the breath weapon, but good creatures that failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} from a vavakia's breath weapon are staggered for 1 round by the excruciating sensation. In addition, any living creature that failed Reflex save from a vavakia's breath weapon must also succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or take 1d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} drain as its sanity slips away into madness.
Immediately after the vavakia expels this green soulfire, the wailing flames flow in reverse into the demon's gullet through its open maw. This restores 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} to the vavakia for each creature that was damaged by its breath weapon.
The Wisdom drain element of this breath weapon is a mind-affecting effect. The save DC is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
1508a175-1cec-44ba-b122-89b6da94a542: Once per demonic rage, you can use this ability to grant one ally all the benefits of the demonic rage, including effects of your active aspects and major aspects as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} until the end of combat.
6d4f32d0-d97e-4968-bb79-3042f259cecb: Order the advisors to study Areelu Vorlesh's drawings
1609fda7-955c-4106-b322-fff4cc350465: Patronage is important in the Abyss. It means that you are useful to someone. It also means that your death will upset someone's plans, and provoke them to anger. It is customary to repay such protection with loyalty. Lady Nocticula has shown the Commander her favor. In return, she has hinted that she would be pleased if {mf|he|she} tracked down Areelu Vorlesh, the Architect of the Worldwound.
2311756c-f1bf-4f10-9be9-17f7896ef12a: Power goes to the strongest. The last one standing at the end of the battle will take it all — the throne, the power, and the veneration. The others will fall dead onto cold, hard stone, and the Commander will have to strive to avoid sharing their fate.
6b976c74-99b6-45d7-b7ab-67eacf70a90d: Reach the location marked on the map by the advisors
b1e48fa7-0412-44db-9e50-92ca46ed889c: Shadow demons are very powerful and dangerous creatures, so their leader is one of the most well-known aristocrats of the city. He and his kind reside in the Middle City, in a place that is easy to identify, for the darkness there terrifies even other demons. That is where the Commander must go to end Ar-Mikheth's life in exchange for a lucrative payment.
c586f8a8-07a4-4f15-9aae-2874ff4bbb4a: Shamira plans to overthrow the Lady in Shadow and seize her throne. The idea of Nocticula being toppled is almost unthinkable. But many millennia ago, the young succubi queen used these same methods to depose the old and powerful demon lord Vyriavaxus. It is up to the Commander to decide if {mf|he|she} supports such a change or opposes it.
ca922479-71db-481b-9ada-363b1797bd87: Shamira the Ardent Dream, the de facto ruler of Alushinyrra, wishes to talk to the Commander. Judging by the fact that this message was relayed through the high-ranking demon Yozz, it must be something extremely important and confidential.
d2d9a614-0060-4767-8b46-bdb62386a97a: Sooner or later, the mysterious spellcaster will succeed in entrapping the Commander with their spell. The Commander must be prepared, and should always stay one step ahead.
579ff634-559d-44de-bf6a-5489675e1600: Starting at the 4th mythic rank and every rank thereafter, Demon gains a Demonic Aspect. These aspects use other Demons as inspiration and allow the Demon to focus the rage more effectively.
ee333d4c-d6a4-4d37-b05e-38084df33804: Take the contents of Areelu's cache
8dfcadea-c71f-4358-8169-58b8cd2a5613: Target's main weapon becomes +5 Living Bane weapon for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per mythic rank as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
700411c4-7f39-4dd1-8db2-6fb819f9abac: The Commander did not hesitate to renounce all that was kind and pure in {mf|his|her} heart. {mf|He|She} welcomed evil into {mf|his|her} soul, and is now as cruel and ruthless as any demon.
42e7d227-dd8c-486b-a185-e1209214154d: The Commander failed to capture Areelu Vorlesh. However, exploring her old place of residence has provided {mf|him|her} with valuable insights into what she has been doing for the last hundred years. This is important information. In every culture throughout history, strategists have advised military leaders to practice the old adage — "know your enemy."
3a5460f2-aac6-4ad5-a364-c2a3fcf2c2f6: The Commander has picked up the trail of Areelu Vorlesh. {mf|He|She} has also discovered irrefutable proof of Nocticula's lies and manipulation. It would not be surprising if the Lady in Shadow had made {mf|him|her} an unwitting participant in one of her schemes, a small part of an insidious plan, perhaps, or a pawn doomed to perish in a bloody gambit. The Commander should make every effort to discover what role the powerful ruler of Alushinyrra had in store for {mf|him|her}.
b2cec23c-b9a7-4560-b84a-f87a4556f4a8: The Commander's advisors managed to pinpoint the location from which Areelu Vorlesh drew the landscape depicted in her notebook. It is safe to assume that there must be some kind of camp or residence near this location. Why else would the Architect of the Worldwound make sketches of this place for so many years?
ea3c7115-c601-47a6-89d6-88c5afb6d09d: The Commander's discovery has brought {mf|him|her} one step closer to finding Areelu Vorlesh, the Architect of the Worldwound and sworn enemy of the crusaders. It remains to be seen whether a stack of faded drawings in an old notebook will be enough to lead the Commander to {mf|his|her} enemy.
f7d54b47-4672-4beb-9c61-8cea25b47146: The Lady in Shadow showed the Commander a magic symbol that can be inscribed near {mf|his|her} chambers and used to travel swiftly to Nocticula's palace in the Abyss.
aeaf7272-a32b-48a2-9ea4-7426c3f0050b: The demon can grow claws at will, gaining two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. These attacks are considered primary attacks and are made at the demon's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. The claws deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} (1d6 if Small) plus the demon's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. If one of the claws is used in concert with a weapon held in the other hand, the claw attack is made at the demon's full base attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} –5 and deals 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus half the demon's Strength modifier.
880ea639-42d2-4c04-b203-a2c0bc21ffba: The demons used dark magic to move the Commander to the Ivory Labyrinth — a prison that is almost impossible to escape. The Ivory Labyrinth's grim reputation is enough to deter any attempts at freedom. Even the name itself fills the heart with despair, and those who hear it find themselves deprived of the will to survive, and the strength to escape.
d80747c7-7750-4396-8061-80e98fa3ce2e: The investigation has yielded results. The evidence indicates that the person sought by the Commander once stayed at Nocticula's palace. It is a known fact that she has a habit of leaving her signature behind, an invisible magic symbol that is revealed by blood. Armed with this information, the Commander now has good reason to search the palace of the Lady in Shadow. A further investigation may result in additional clues that could prove useful in trying to locate this person of interest.
671242f8-5fb8-4801-9dfd-a800b781daac: The mysterious benefactor who saved the Commander from Baphomet's prison has revealed herself once more. It might be worth accepting her invitation.
b7761b7e-9ef3-433c-9264-6b89a559b9fb:
The power of the Abyss courses through the Demon waiting to be unleashed. The Demon can enter a demonic rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The demonic rage lasts until the end of combat. While in demonic rage, the Demon gains +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and Reflex saving throws. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Demon's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities are increased by 2. These benefits increase by 1 at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
You can use Demonic Rage 3 times per day. Number of uses increases by 1 at 6th and 9th mythic ranks.
9534e492-2711-47aa-a021-23d72f0712e6: The sound of a derakni in flight is a mesmerizing, unsettling drone that causes confusion in all non-demons who hear the sound. A derakni can activate this ability once per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Any non-demon creature within 30 feet of a derakni must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or become confused for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds. A creature that makes this save is immune to the drone of that derakni for 24 hours. Demons are immune to this sonic, mind-affecting effect.
6e467ca4-b7b5-43f1-b728-08951247d657: The target is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} plus {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} plus additional 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for every dead creature in a 30-foot radius.
57f45645-4efa-4bf0-8f2b-285c59aed9b1: There are many ways a soul can be corrupted. Sinful behavior, ruthlessness, a lust for power, an indifference to the suffering of others, and the indulgence of carnal desires — all of these will befoul the heart with evil. However, the Commander will have to do all these things and more to become a true demon.
2f524a91-a1e8-49ba-b6f5-4315c37e878a: This ability summons a Babau for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
382206cb-878e-49e5-a7ac-db52c2891efe: This ability summons a Balor for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
1274e0c9-8d9a-437e-be6f-def8526bc544: This ability summons a Gibrileth for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
80fd10a9-cddb-4f96-9703-51f94fe4a92f: This ability summons a Lilitu for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
ab1d03c0-2eb8-4729-8bb4-fc1389bb7cca: This ability summons a Painajai for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
03779539-cc39-4ea4-9e4f-78692b065f8f: This ability summons a Vrock for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
f7c08b97-bec3-4540-abf0-7be07dbf381d: This ability summons a Vrolikai for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
41493abc-3cb5-4eea-ac17-141b47b9ac92: This ability summons an Oolioddroo for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
647283a1-6e98-4eac-8236-c80e937ea37f: This notebook was discovered in Nocticula's palace. It once belonged to Areelu Vorlesh and contains a series of sketches made in the same location, at different times. The drawings show how the landscape changed as a result of the Worldwound. The sketches were made a long time ago, so it is difficult to say what the place would look like now. However, the Commander's advisors will be able to use the landscape's features to determine its location.
b46652e8-2606-4118-bfbd-d64f4e1fd6d4:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} acts as Telekinetic Strike, but affects all enemies in a 30-foot radius around the caster.
Telekinetic Strike: You create an invisible force, which {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} the enemy for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The target then makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}. If it is failed, the target becomes prone and you either push or pull it with a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}Combat Maneuver{/g}, using your caster level in place of {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}BAB{/g} and casting stat in place of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
4e29837d-5b04-459a-865e-9c2cd66eea88: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to polymorph into a form of a babau, brimorak or schir for 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
f22dcc43-2041-4d56-919b-f01caaaa0a0b: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to polymorph into a form of a balor, vavakia, gallu or marilith for 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
041c2d21-0124-45fa-ae6a-0035a3d3a2a6: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to polymorph into a form of a derakni, kalavakus or nabasu for 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
13ec87e4-ba5a-4321-8b4a-b2567c04ba91: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to polymorph into a form of a glabrezu, vrock or nalfeshnee for 1 minute per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
96f33b03-e951-4e17-8d25-51e730e1ca1b:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} creates abyssal chains that begin that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and bind your enemies.
The chains deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to the primary target, and entangle it for the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to caster level. After they strike, the chains continue their way to a number of secondary targets equal to your caster level. The secondary chains each strike one target and deal as much damage as the primary one and entangle the targets.
Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage and to ignore the entangling effect. Secondary targets must be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once.
24b9cb8f-4899-40d2-94fb-686a5167aa87: Wait 7 days for Areelu's drawings to be deciphered.
604f7a44-d075-4ab4-a243-d2c3f5d19a1d:
Whenever the Demon would become paralyzed, frightened, cowering, or stunned, they instead fall into an uncontrolled rage for an equal duration. The Demon gains immunity to the effects of dazed, paralyzed, petrified, frightened, cowering, sleeping, stunned, and confused conditions as well as other movement- and {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}-impairing effects. The Demon's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} becomes equal to their {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}, and their {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} becomes equal to double their mythic rank + 16. The Demon gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} equal to double their mythic rank + 10, a +6 enhancement bonus to Strength, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} ability scores, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. All of the Demon's weapons deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if two {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger than they actually are.
While in an uncontrolled rage, the Demon can't tell friend from foe: the Demon loses control of themselves and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} the nearest creature.
c58965c6-62ca-4783-9b18-bbe867109e0f: Whenever you hit the target with a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, it makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}. If it is successful, the target suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the saving throw failed, the damage is increased to 3d6 damage per caster level. If the damage kills the target, you regain 10 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per caster level.
16d6415a-bc45-4070-a135-7c2e8464add6: You can now use one more minor aspect simultaneously.
026c4639-c76e-4053-9ae6-2b5545a0dc2d: You can only use this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} while in Demonic Rage. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you grant the effects of Demonic Rage to all allies in a 30-foot range for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
d2471fc0-2a35-4c39-a781-b68fa1730777: You can only use this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} while in Demonic Rage. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you grant the target effects of Demonic Rage for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
62c2c23b-3ffb-462e-be5e-f1cfe456fc9b: You can shoot a ray as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. If it hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} unholy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}.
4e45b73c-47bd-4064-ab84-619abbf74ea9: You conjure abyssal energies to empower your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. The next two attacks, plus one additional attack per 5 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} above 7 (one at CL 12, two at CL 17) deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} unholy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 2 caster levels. Alternatively, you can use one of the charges to make a range {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, dealing the same amount of damage.
1309cfa9-262f-4d8f-b2e0-6c3e7df194b2: You create a devastating storm of abyssal energies, which deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} electricity and 1d6 unholy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to every creature in a 40-foot radius around you.
b683d9a7-f442-45e3-b4f6-e101500c725c: You create an invisible force, which {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} the enemy for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. The target then makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}. If it is failed, the target becomes prone and you either push or pull it with a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}Combat Maneuver{/g}, using your caster level in place of {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}BAB{/g} and casting stat in place of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}.
7b209cfe-fc49-4495-90fe-2b7733d7e0cc:
You gain a +3 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to Persuasion {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate, all demons summoned by Demonic Regent receive an immunity to fire and are under Shield of Dawn effect. Demonic Regent also gains the following ability:
Profane Benediction (Su): Demonic Regent can grant himself a +2 profane bonus to an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. Simultaneously only one such effect can be in place.
86eaa609-d1d8-4ddc-a77f-47a756727f28:
You gain a +5 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate. All demons summoned by Demonic Overlord receive an immunity to fire, are under Shield of Dawn effect and immune to charm and compulsion effects. Demonic Overlord also gains the following ability:
Profane Invocation: Demonic Overlord can grant himself a +2 profane bonus to two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}. Simultaneously only one such effect can be in place.
d4b517a5-2fd5-4ba9-9eda-c4faf694789b: You gain a natural armor bonus equal to 1 + 1 per 3 caster levels. You also gain resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashes{/g}. The caster gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/cold iron and good. It ignores the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each time it takes damage from a weapon. Once the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, it is discharged.
7bed2635-54b2-4b51-82a6-b42914408ea9:
You make the target appear more intimidating, while making it possible to feed on fear. The target gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g} made to intimidate equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} the target is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} for 1 hp for every shaken or frightened enemy in a 30-foot radius. This effect works for a number of rounds equal to your caster level.
When the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is cast, every enemy in 10 feet around the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be frightened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds.
afc116e6-bf7e-4688-9e97-37e77b637c1d: You make your blood boil, making you faster and more ferocious. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per two caster levels, you gain the effects of the Haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. Additionally, every time you reduce a creature below zero {g|Encyclopedia:HP}HP{/g}, you prolong the effect. If the killed creature had more HD than your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, the duration is increased by 3 rounds. Otherwise, it is increased by 1 round.
cb325c02-ce0a-4633-a703-4e2af1f20692: You take the form of a babau, getting its protective slime ability.
f085a453-d098-446f-af78-5c788624286f: You take the form of a balor, getting its vorpal strike ability.
d03b177a-c54b-4496-983f-c0c54e4a0630: You take the form of a brimorak, getting its fire breath and flaming weapon abilities.
5a557e9d-5d8a-40bc-893a-7daa272361f0: You take the form of a derakni, getting its poison and drone abilities.
67824daf-6799-4d0b-898a-0a5a8e8e1dac: You take the form of a gallu, getting its rain of blood ability.
696616bd-707b-4103-a24b-52abc376ea0c: You take the form of a glabrezu, getting its rend ability.
71f9f73f-6251-4417-aeb8-8c00f779eb5c: You take the form of a kalavakus, getting its powerful charge and horns abilities.
d255eae7-8353-4847-b071-c1584f077026: You take the form of a marilith, getting its crushing tail ability.
974de1a7-20f3-49c2-b909-358b9a82625d: You take the form of a nabasu, getting its {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}-stealing gaze ability, which they can use for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
7e4a1e3e-6bcd-4b7f-8a71-6ea22696c692: You take the form of a nalfeshnee, getting its incredible {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g}.
61ab9654-4dd2-42f2-8b0b-e8a4e4bd2e11: You take the form of a schir, getting its powerful charge ability.
13f4ba80-e0fb-4fe1-bd93-64752be60b3d: You take the form of a vavakia, getting its breath weapon ability.
6df738f4-2ceb-4c32-a3e5-fdfbd3eb04f0: You take the form of a vrock, getting its Mirror Image ability.
5e364941-c351-4517-a2cf-022e3041c25f: Yozz has asked the Commander to visit him at the Assassins' Guild to discuss an interesting job.
03542caf-5803-44bf-bf57-849721843f2a: Yozz, head of Alushinyrra's Assassins' Guild, has offered the Commander a lucrative deal — a large reward and his favor in exchange for the death of a demon named Ar-Mikheth, the leader of the shadow demons who reside in the city. Now that Nocticula is nowhere to be found and her patronage no longer protects the Golarian visitor as reliably as before, it is time for the Commander to think about acquiring new allies and consolidating {mf|his|her} own power.
